sense.name: behave unnaturally (to deceive), claim, feign or act.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] PRETEND TO NP2 NP1[agent] PRETEND (that) NP2 NP1[agent] PRETEND NP2
sense.examples: Should Hillary pretend to be a flight attendant? I'm pretending to be a tiger! Rawr! Bogus calls pretend to be the police. Pretend (that) the world has ended. Let's pretend! Never pretend to a love which you do not feel. He pretended the title of King. Melody pretended the role of predator in The Black Forest. I cannot pretend to know the truth.
